column2: Depending on the selection the extension will communicate with the FreePay test / sandbox / production service. Choose custom, if you have to use special urls for the gateway.

column1: You will be redirected to the FreePay website when you place an order.
column2: You will be redirected to the FreePay website when you place an order.

column1: Status given to newly created orders before payment result confirmation via server notifications from FreePay.
column2: Status given to newly created orders before payment result confirmation via server notifications from FreePay.

column1: Transition status assigned to orders after cancellation and waiting for FreePay notification (CANCEL_OR_REFUND). If orders are already invoiced, they cannot be cancelled, but will be refunded instead.
column2: Transition status assigned to orders after cancellation and waiting for FreePay notification (CANCEL_OR_REFUND). If orders are already invoiced, they cannot be cancelled, but will be refunded instead.

column1: Status given to order after a refund has been made on the order. This is triggered when the REFUND notification is received.
column2: Status given to order after a refund has been made on the order. This is triggered when the REFUND notification is received.

column1: Status given to order after a partial refund has been made on the order. This is triggered when the REFUND notification is received. We advise to don't set this status and let Magento decide the status.
column2: Status given to order after a partial refund has been made on the order. This is triggered when the REFUND notification is received. We advise to don't set this status and let Magento decide the status.

column1: Cancel Order asked. Waiting for FreePay notification. Payment Id: "%s".
